column4: Any help on removing files from a previously made boot-USB that now says "read only" when I need to wipe it to make a fresh install flash drive?
you want to wipe it?
yes and it's a PNY 16gb usb flashdrive
cd into the directory, rm -rf * ?
sorry if my command line work is a bit lacking but the USB says it's at /dev/sde and when I try to cd that I got as far as /dev$
sde would be a file, no.

that's okay and I can see it on my disk utility as /dev/sde so that's as far as I've gotten. do you at least know how to get past the whole "read only" part? I used to know, but have forgotten long ago
wouldn't it just be sudo?
haha yeah, if I remember the command for a wipe. I'm doing this all in-GUI ;_;
D:
don't know if this helps any but when I plug the flash drive in it is recocgnized by the Boot Disk Creator but not my filesystem...
that's really odd.. can't you just format it?
I tried using the Boot Disk Creator and it runs (making /dev/sde1 partition) but then when I try to open the partition to make the install drive nothing happens
That's really odd. :S
you're telling me. I've done this a hundred times over and NEVER seen this problem before.
is something different from before?
Only that these drives were used in an old SL install that when awry. Now I can't recocgnize, locate, format or remove files from them. It's insane
it is. I'm intrigued now.

however, I've already tried on other USB's and the same issues are coming up. In fact, every drive attatched to my machine is seen as an unrecocgnized drive that needs "format"ing before I can use through the USB startup disk creator or whatever it's called
Sounds just like Window-
Haha too right. And I hate to do and try Windows to solve the problem but I'm running out of time >_<
I'm the same. I refuse to use it unless I have to. :/
and izinucs, an update: I was 'saved' by... windows... VISTA (DAMN!) but now I have a bootdisk and a netbook with 10.10NBR and I feel safe again (like wrapped in blankets). Thanks for all yer help
